definition:
A *regular triangle* is one for which all sides are congruent and all
interior angles are congruent.

All regular triangles are regular polygons. Also, by the isosceles
triangle theorem, the bisector of any angle coincides with the height,
the median and the perpendicular bisector of the opposite side.

The following statements hold in Euclidean geometry for a regular
triangle.

-   If $r$ is the length of the side, then the height is equal to
    $\displaystyle \frac{r\sqrt{3}}{2}$.

-   If $r$ is the length of the side, then the area is equal to
    $\displaystyle \frac{r^2\sqrt{3}}{4}$.
